net.proteusframework.ui.search

Class QLRowDataModel<RT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.search.QLRowDataModel<RT>
  • Type Parameters:
    RT - the row type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>, TableModelListener

    public class QLRowDataModel<RT>
extends Object
implements BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>, TableModelListener
    A row data model based on a QLBuilder.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Description copied from interface: BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel
        Returns the number of rows in the model. If the number of rows cannot be efficiently determined, this method may return -1. In that case the isRowValid() method can be used to determine if a given row is valid.
        Specified by:
        getRowCount in interface BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>
        Returns:
        The number of rows or -1 if the number of rows cannot efficiently be calculated.
        See Also:
        TableModel.getRowCount()

      • getRowId

        public String getRowId(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from interface: BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel

        Get an unqiue ID for the row. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the row in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent. When accessing the table model, the ID may be used to find the row index.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Specified by:
        getRowId in interface BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.
        See Also:
        TableModel.getRowId(int)

      • getWindowSize

        public int getWindowSize()
        Get the window size.
        Returns:
        the window size.

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        Invalidate the row model.

      • isRowValid

        public boolean isRowValid(int rowIndex)
        Description copied from interface: BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel
        Returns true if the row is valid in this model. In general a row should be valid if it is less than the value of getRowCount(). Determining getRowCount() may not be efficient for all models so this method is provided to determine if a given row is valid. It is assumed that if a row is invalid, all the rows with an index greater than the row checked are also invalid.
        Specified by:
        isRowValid in interface BaseDataColumnTableModel.RowDataModel<RT>
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index.
        Returns:
        true if the row is valid.
        See Also:
        TableModel.isRowValid(int)

      • setWindowSize

        public void setWindowSize(int windowSize)
        Set the window size. The window size, is the amount of data retrieved at a time. This should be at least as large as the paging size.
        Parameters:
        windowSize - the window size.
